blogs.author: Muthama Caleb

content.rendered:
The journey of a young Boy

There was once a boy who lived in the distant plains of Sakwa. He lived there with his parents but he deep down he knew he was destined for greatness and would not be tied down to one place like a goat. He had to find a way to the Great City of Kisuma, he had heard stories about it. How tall building were. How beautiful women are with theirs lovely succulent thighs out.

He had this vivid image in his brain how Kisuma looked like and he would do anything in his power to go there. So he made a list of things he shall do once he sets his foot there:

  • Sleep with the local whores.

  • Go into the drinking dens and sample the brew everyone talked about.

  • Go for a swim in the great Kisuma lake.

Life of a bachelor

Well there is nothing much to do. You wake up at 11am with matorotoro on you eyes, you can't even see your next steep but you are grateful for being alive. You look at your phone lazily and see how how people are the 5am club and the see you as lazy but the don't know you sleep way pas midnight debugging code that would not tii watho.

So you take a pen to write down the things you will do that day:

  • Kuchoma kwa mathe.

  • Kukula kwa mathe wa kiwaru akifunguwa jioni

  • Nunuwa kasukari kaa ten, kangumu ya thirty and majani ya 10 and call it breakfast.

  • Alafu jioni nunuwa skuma ya thirty upike ugali and you call it a day.

All we have is a dream: Dream ya kutoka kwa block

That's the life of a bachelor; a boring one but full of peace. We give thanks everyday, Alhamdulillah.

Bed me, oh love

A break I'd want to have

I lose tranquil on thought: my beloved

Spasms ran through my head

From spine root to the core: thalamus
